metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday / Second Sunday after Pentecost

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose inner nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems a humanity that is in a state of 'primordial catastrophe' and self-destruction.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The love that persists in breaking through our resistance
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

object.identificatie: Redemption and Restoration of the 'miserable offender'

tekstueel_bewijs: whose nature it is to give that love to his creatures without restraint
redeem Israel from all his iniquities

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (Incarnation/Blood) and the Holy Spirit (Fellowship)
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son
the love that has become incarnate in history through Jesus Christ

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a 'Vast Primordial Catastrophe' and Human Resistance
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as petty rule-breaking but as a catastrophic ontological state ('no health in us') that requires a divine subject to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Human beings reflecting God's love through parental or relational care.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Parents/Aunts/Teachers (Human 'hints' of God)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Human love is presented as a 'glimmer' or 'hint' that prepares the receiver to understand the primary program of Divine love.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Divine Love → Redemption → The Miserable Offender
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Christ's Blood → Triune God ← Primordial Catastrophe

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pursues us even beyond the grave
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We have followed too much the devices
Think about those people who have borne with you

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
God... whose nature it is to give
discovery that he is a God of infinite mercy
the God who can redeem humanity from so grave a predicament

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'ability' (Pouvoir) to save where man has 'no health' (lack of Pouvoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'depths' (S2) through the negation of human merit (~S1) to the realization of absolute Grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Fear of the Lord' which is a response to the overwhelming S1 (Forgiveness).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; uses terms like 'miserable offenders' and 'no health in us'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly rejects human merit and positions God as the sole agent of redemption in the face of a 'heavy' opponent (Sin/Death).

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in Paul's parenting analogy
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Paul will try almost any argument to see if he can somehow rebuild trust

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The God who pursues us even beyond the grave
There is no health in us

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul is used as an example of an agonizing parent, and human parents are used as 'hints' of God.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by stating human love is only a 'small measure' of the divine reality.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'renewed confidence' through external rescue.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the Trinity (Inner Love) to the Psalm (Human Need) is logically bridged by the concept of 'Self-giving love'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop of the blood of the Son.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' that conveys the love of God to the incompetent subject.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; described as a 'primordial catastrophe' and 'estrangement'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative. Human action is relegated to 'confession' (honesty) which is a response to, not a cause of, grace.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Continue emphasizing the 'depths' to keep the hearer from assuming the Subject role.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-orientation.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The opponent is already sufficiently 'heavy' to necessitate a Divine Subject.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining the 'Grammar of Grace.' It avoids the trap of turning the Trinity into a social model for us to imitate, focusing instead on the Trinity as the source of a rescue we cannot achieve ourselves.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the parental pathos; Greimas shows this is merely a 'helper' to the primary actant (God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would look at the Greek of 2 Cor 13; Greimas looks at the functional roles of the Trinity in the preacher's universe.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'fear of the Lord' is an actantial response to the Subject's (God) overwhelming 'Pouvoir-faire' (Power to forgive).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Rutledge's own principles effectively.
